{"step_by_step_thinking": "Migratory motor complexes (MMCs) are a pattern of electrical activity that occurs in the gastrointestinal tract during the periods between meals. It is thought to serve a 'housekeeping' role and sweep residual undigested material through the digestive tube. As per medical literature, MMCs typically occur in a regular cycle every 90 to 120 minutes.", "answer_choice": "B. 90 minutes"}
